image.altText: An adult and a child walking across a pedestrian crossing in a school zone, with the bonnet of a car in the left foreground.

props.synopsis: Canberra mother Veronica Fortune says the road past her local school is an accident waiting to happen. She's written to MLAs about safety improvements and campaigned for adjustments to the roads, but so far nothing has changed.

title.children: Would you accept a 30kph school zone speed limit?

image.altText: A man with short dark hair in a navy suit and tie looks down at a smartphone as he walks out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: The trial of a man accused of committing sexual offences against an 11-year-old girl hears he used dating app Badoo to speak and meet with her, and later arranged to meet up with her to have sex.

title.children: 'Tell no-one': Man met 11yo alleged victim on dating app, court hears

image.altText: A man wearing a white button down shirt, black jeans and large sunglasses walks out of a court building holding papers.

props.synopsis: Canberra 28-year-old Jett Black, who was among a group of detainees that in late 2020 started a prison riot sparked by a lack of cigarettes, no dessert and COVID restrictions, walks free from court.

title.children: Canberra man told to 'make different friends' in prison riot sentencing

image.altText: Seven teenage boys stand in a circle on an outdoor basketball court listening to a man in a white beanie speaking.

props.synopsis: Menslink workshops are helping young men tackle harmful social expectations, loneliness and anger, by stirring up the toxicity "all around them" and encouraging them to decide what sort of men they want to be.

title.children: Confidential sessions challenging 'toxic' masculinity in teen boys

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Depraved and violent torture is how an ACT Supreme Court judge described the actions of a brother found guilty of sexually abusing his two sisters over several years, as he was sentenced to over 16 years in jail.

title.children: Canberra judge jails brother for 'depraved' abuse of sisters

image.altText: A rabbit outside Parliament House

props.synopsis: Rabbits were introduced to Australia during colonisation, with 'plagues' causing widespread environmental, agricultural and economic destruction. Nowadays the pest is controlled using biocontrol, but experts say without funding the population could soon be out of control.

title.children: The ACT could be looking down the burrow of a rabbit plague

image.altText: Two skiers, with backs to the camera, at the top of a mountain beside a ski lift.

props.synopsis: Towns in the Snowy Mountains rely on tourist dollars during winter, but as the cost of living bites, Aussies are looking for ways to enjoy snow holidays on a budget.

title.children: How Aussies are affording a 'bloody expensive' trip to the snow

image.altText: thumbnail satellite 1

props.synopsis: Missile strikes and fires have torn through Iran's nuclear and military facilities. These satellite images show the damage that has been inflicted by Israel's attacks.

title.children: Before and after Israel's attacks on Iran's nuclear and military facilities

image.altText: Penny Wong

props.synopsis: The Australian government is unable to make repatriation flights while airspace in the two countries remains closed, but is making preparations to assist the departures of those who wish to leave.

title.children: Hundreds of Australians seek help to leave Israel and Iran

image.altText: An explosion in front of high-rise building in a city at night.

props.synopsis: Iran had the largest and most diverse ballistic missile stockpile in the Middle East, but recent Israeli strikes on the country's military infrastructure may limit its capabilities to keep fighting back.

title.children: What weapons does Iran have to continue Israel strikes?

image.altText: Donald Trump points at someone with his right hand index finger.

props.synopsis: Key defence figures on both sides of the Atlantic warn the risks to AUKUS run deeper than whether a review finds it is "America first" enough for Donald Trump.

title.children: 'No penalties, no refunds': US quitting AUKUS would leave Australia high and dry

image.altText: A bouquet of yellow roses sits on the rainy ground in front of a police car.

props.synopsis: Police say a member of the public allegedly shot an officer dead as he approached a house in Tasmania's north-west on "routine duties".

title.children: Tasmania Police officer shot dead while approaching house

image.altText: A young man in a black hoodie outside a courthouse after appearing on a charge of grievous bodily harm.

props.synopsis: Jaxon Jai Trinidad allegedly used the sword to cut off his father James Nybo's arm during a confrontation earlier this year.

title.children: Man whose arm was severed by samurai sword yet to speak to police

image.altText: A man with a blue shirt and a measuring tape around his shoulders stands next to a mannequin with a long skirt.

props.synopsis: Police in Utah are investigating the fatal shooting of renowned Samoan fashion designer Arthur Folasa Ah Loo at an anti-Trump "No Kings" protest in Salt Lake City.

title.children: 'Trendsetter': Tributes for Samoan fashion designer killed at anti-Trump march

image.altText: Thuimb

props.synopsis: Australian tennis champ Ash Barty and her husband Garry Kissick welcome their daughter Jordan into the world.

title.children: Tennis legend Ash Barty announces birth of daughter Jordan

image.altText: Nick Smith and Roy Quaden composite image.

props.synopsis: An independent review into last year’s tragic Sydney to Hobart yacht race, which resulted in the deaths of two sailors, has found helmets would do little to prevent catastrophic injuries.

title.children: Independent review releases findings after deadly Sydney to Hobart race

image.altText: Gareth Ward arrives

props.synopsis: A man who accused former NSW government minister Gareth Ward of sexual assault told a friend he was afraid to report the allegations because of the MP's political influence, a court has heard.

title.children: Man too scared of MP's 'power' to report alleged rape, court hears

image.altText: baby

props.synopsis: A five-month-old girl was taken to hospital after an e-bike rider sprayed a fire extinguisher into a car that was waiting at traffic lights.

title.children: Baby injured after 'horrific' fire extinguisher attack on Sunshine Coast

image.altText: Australian writer Alistair Kitchen stands holding a laptop he says he was denied entry to the United States

props.synopsis: Melbourne writer Alistair Kitchen was detained for 12 hours at Los Angeles International Airport, had his phone seized and was "interrogated" about his views on the conflict in the Middle East.

title.children: Australian denied entry to US after being grilled on Israel-Gaza views

image.altText: Jim Rogers

props.synopsis: There were signs for years that something was wrong, and Jim Rogers's doctor put it down to stress. But when the 55-year-old couldn't silence his phone, his world began to unravel.

title.children: The early signs of dementia that Jim missed for years

image.altText: A villa in Bali where three motobikes are parked outside and the entrance is cornered off with police tap

props.synopsis: Zivan Radmanovic was killed on Saturday when two men broke into the villa he was staying in near the Bali tourist hotspot Canggu.

title.children: Bali police retract statement over arrest in Australian man's death in Bali villa shooting

image.altText: Seven Network's logo on a building

props.synopsis: Regional residents in parts of South Australia and New South Wales could lose access to Seven Network channels on their TVs from next month after negotiations with WIN Network broke down.

title.children: Free-to-air AFL and  cricket could disappear from parts of SA and NSW

image.altText: A close-up shot of a ram.

props.synopsis: A ram sold for a world record price of $450,000 back in 1989, but a Country Hour reporter remembers it as the peak before the fall for Australia's wool industry.

title.children: The $450,000 ram and what became of Australia's wool industry

image.altText: Members of law enforcement agencies investigate near a vehicle suspected to belong to shooting suspect

props.synopsis: Police say they have arrested the man suspected of killing a US politician and her husband after a days-long manhunt.

title.children: Alleged Minnesota assassin arrested after statewide manhunt

image.altText: A man in army uniform kneels on the sand beside an unexploded bomb, while another man stands watching.

props.synopsis: Specialist ADF bomb technicians have flown into a remote Arnhem Land town to detonate three World War II-era bombs on a local beach.

title.children: World War II-era bombs detonated on remote Arnhem Land beach

image.altText: a composite image of Alex Greenwich and Mark Latham

props.synopsis: A case initiated by Sydney MP Alex Greenwich involves the same graphic tweet previously at the centre of defamation proceedings against Mark Latham.

title.children: Latham's comments about Sydney MP were unlawful homosexual vilification, court told

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit at a microphone in front of a wall of plants.

props.synopsis: As the Australian prime minister prepares to meet with the US president for their first face-to-face meeting, only one is leading a country where democracy is thriving and the public isn't bitterly divided.

title.children: Australia is having a 'democracy bounce'. Trump could learn a lesson

image.altText: Four members of Grammy nominated band Hiatus Kaiyote pose against pink backdrop

props.synopsis: When Australian musician Paul Bender looked into why tracks he hadn't made were appearing on his Spotify profile, what he found was a security exploit that's making AI-generated music scams easier than ever.

title.children: 'Laughable': Aussie artist says scammers flooding Spotify with AI fakes

image.altText: Three men, one wearing a cap with electrodes, stand in front of computer screens in a room.

props.synopsis: Sydney researchers have developed an AI model that can decipher words and sentences from brainwaves detected by a wearable cap. It opens up a new frontier to help patients with cognition, but could also revolutionise how humans interact with computers.

title.children: AI is everywhere and now it's being used to read our minds

image.altText: An almost-finished modular home sitting on concrete blocks.

props.synopsis: Affordable housing is shaping up as a major focus for the Cook government in the lead-up to Thursday's budget, with a shared ownership scheme the latest offer.

title.children: Low deposit loans offered for smaller homes as housing crisis rolls on

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a man charged over an alleged serious assault in Melbourne's inner west over the weekend was released from immigration detention following a 2023 High Court ruling.

title.children: Released immigration detainee charged over serious Melbourne assault

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne carries his bat, helmet and gloves

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne's former coach backs him to turn around what has been a two-year slump in Test cricket, urging Australia not to drop him.

title.children: Langer urges Australia to not axe 'very important link' Marnus from Test side

image.altText: a police tent in an area in werrington where a body was found

props.synopsis: The body of the 47-year-old woman was found by a member of the public on Sunday partially-clothed and face down at a reserve in Werrington.

title.children: Man arrested a day after woman's body found in Sydney's west

image.altText: Phoebe Thorburn snuggles on a couch with their black labrador. They are both looking up and Phoebe is smiling.

props.synopsis: Others thought getting a big dog was an unnecessary stress but the commitment, while challenging, gave me exactly what I was looking for.

title.children: How the responsibility of owning a large dog has changed my life
